item.title: Kelly add a quote by Publilius
item.description: "No man is happy unless he believes he is." -- Publilius

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Smashing Pumpkins
item.description: "I fear that I am ordinary, just like everyone." -- Smashing Pumpkins

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Oliver Wendall Holmes
item.description: "The right to swing my fist ends where the other man's nose begins." -- Oliver Wendall Holmes

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him." -- Voltaire

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Georg Hegel
item.description: "We learn from history that we do not learn from history" -- Georg Hegel

item.title: Kelly add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "The turning points of lives are not the great moments. The real crises are often concealed in occurrences so trivial in appearance that they pass unobserved." -- George Washington

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right, and raises at first a formidable outcry in defense of custom. But the tumult soon subsides. Time makes more converts than reason." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Kelly add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Ingrid Bergman
item.description: "A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous." -- Ingrid Bergman

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "Kissing power is stronger than will power." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "The greatest pleasure I know is to do a good action by stealth, and to have it found out by accident." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Kelly add a quote by William James
item.description: "A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices." -- William James

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
item.description: "People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within." -- Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Those who are easily shocked should be shocked more often." -- Mae West

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Georg Christoph Lichtenberg
item.description: "A book is a mirror: if an ape looks into it an apostle is hardly likely to look out." -- Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Chris Rock
item.description: "You know the world is going crazy when the best rapper is a white guy, the best golfer is a black guy, the tallest guy in the NBA is Chinese, the Swiss hold the America's Cup, France is accusing the U.S. of arrogance, Germany doesn't want to go to war, and the three most powerful men in America are named "Bush", "Dick", and "Colin." Need I say more?" -- Chris Rock

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. " -- Mae West

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn’t." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "It's the good girls who keep diaries; the bad girls never have the time." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jean Kerr
item.description: "Marrying a man is like buying something you've been admiring for a long time in a shop window. You may love it when you get home, but it doesn't always go with everything in the house. " -- Jean Kerr

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf
